notes: Killed while at home with his family.

name: Ibrahim Muhammad Kassab Shurab
notes: Killed in a car while riding with his father and brothers during a cease fire when soldiers shot at them, striking the father, who was driving, causing him to crash into a wall. Soldiers ordered them to get out of the car and when they did so, fired at them. The brother Kasab was killed by a shot in the stomach, and Ibrahim was shot in the legs and bled to death until midnight, while soldiers stood by.

name: Bilal Muhammad Shehdeh al-Ashqar

notes: Killed in a condolence tent in a-Shaja'iyah neighborhood. Armed persons were operating in the area.

After the soldiers left the area, his brother found his body next to al-'Amudi intersection, in the northern part of the city. He had been shot in the thigh and apparently bled for two days, during which nobody was able to come to his aid.

name: Faiz Sa'id Faraj Shmali

name: Ahmad Salamah 'Abd al-Hai Abu 'Aytah

name: Baraa 'Ata Hassan Irmeilat

name: 'Aishah 'Ayad 'Eid Irmeilat

name: Ahmad Ousamah Muhammad Qurtom

name: Sa'id Muhammad Sha'ban Siyam

B'Tselem's investigation indicates that armed militants apparently were not present in the area.

name: Sayed 'Amer Rizeq Abu 'Eishah

B'Tselem's investigation indicates that armed militants apparently were not present in the area.

B'Tselem's investigation indicates that armed militants apparently were not present in the area.

name: 'Amer Rizeq Saber Abu 'Eishah

name: Ibrahim Mu'in al-'Abed Juha

name: Shahd Muhammad Amin Heji
notes: Daughter of Muhammad Amin Haji, who had previously been killed by a shell that struck the family's house. Killed with Muhammad Samir Haji and 'Ola 'Arafat by soldiers' gunfire as they tried along with other persons to reach a safe place, after soldiers ordered them to leave their house. Her mother was wounded.

name: Muhammad Samir Amin Heji
notes: Killed along with Shahd Haji and 'Ula 'Arafat from soldiers' fire while they were trying to reach a safe place with other persons. His name was mentioned on the Islamic Jihad website.

name: 'Ula Ma'sud Khalil 'Arafat

name: Muhammad Amin Mustafa Heji

name: 'Ali Salamah Diab al-Khatib

name: Muhammad Ahmad Muhammad a-Da'ur
notes: His body and the body of his mother were found bullet-ridden in their home.

name: Jamileh 'Abd al-'Aziz Salem a-Da'ur
notes: Her body and the body of her son were found bullet-ridden in their home.

name: a-Sayed Hamuda Shihadah Abu Sultan
notes: Killed while sitting with friends in the yard.

notes: Killed while standing on the roof of his house with members of his family.

notes: Killed while standing on the roof of his house with members of his family.

name: Rayah Salamah Salman Abu Hajaj
notes: Killed with her daughter by a soldier who fired from a tank as she walked with a group of persons carrying a white flag. Their bodies were left in the street until the army withdrew because ambulances were not allowed to reach the site. Previously , the family had to leave their house, which was shelled.

name: Majedah 'Abd al-Karim Abu Hajaj
notes: Killed with her mother by a soldier who fired from a tank as she walked with a group of persons carrying a white flag. Their bodies were left in the street until the army withdrew because ambulances were not allowed to reach the site. Previously , the family had to leave their house, which was shelled.

name: Ghassan 'Ali 'Ali Abu al-'Imrin
notes: Killed by shrapnel that struck him in the head.

name: Bassam Muhammad Faruk Abu 'Ajwah
notes: Killed on his way to shopping by a missile aimed at a vehicle that missed the target.

name: 'Awni Sa'di Salman a-Dib
notes: Killed while standing at the entrance to his house by gunfire aimed at his neighbor, Ahmad Abu Daf, an operative in the military wing of Hamas.

name: Ahmad Khalil Saleh Abu Daf
notes: Killed while standing outside his house.

name: Hamzah Sa'dallah Matar Abu Halimah
notes: Burned to death along with his sister and two brothers when a white-phosphorous shell struck his house. His father was killed when struck directly by the shell. Five other family members were burned by the phosphorous, one of whom later died from her wounds.

name: Zeid Sa'dallah Matar Abu Halimah
notes: Burned to death along with his sister and two brothers when a white-phosphorous shell struck his house. His father was killed when struck directly by the shell. Five other family members were burned by the phosphorous, one of whom later died from her wounds.

name: Shahd Sa'dallah Matar Abu Halimah
notes: Burned to death along with three of her brothers when a white-phosphorous shell struck her house. Her father was killed when struck directly by the shell. Five other family members were burned by the phosphorous, one of whom later died from her wounds.

name: 'Abd a-Rahim Sa'dallah Matar Abu Halimah
notes: Burned to death together with his sister and two brothers when a white-phosphorous shell struck their house. His father was killed when struck directly by the shell. Five others in the family were burned, one of whom later died from her wounds.

name: Muhammad Hikmat Matar Abu Halimah
notes: Shot by soldiers while he and his family were waving a white flag and driving on a tractor-drawn wagon to the hospital, after their house had been shelled with white phosphorous.

name: Matar Sa'ed Matar Abu Halimah
notes: Shot by soldiers while he and his family were waving a white flag and driving on a tractor-drawn wagon to the hospital, after their house had been shelled with white phosphorous.

name: Ghadah Riyad Rajab Abu Halimah
notes: Was severely burned when a white phosphorous shell struck her house, and died later from her wounds. Four others from her family were burned to death in the incident and her father-in-law was killed when struck directly by the shell. Four other family members, including her infant daughter, suffered burns.

name: Luai Yihya Salman Abu Halimah
notes: Killed while playing with friends outside his house. His friends were wounded.

name: Sa'dallah Matar Ma'sud Abu Halimah
notes: Was directly hit and killed by a white phosphorous shell that entered his house. Four of his children were burned to death in the incident and his daughter-in-law was severely burned and later died from her wounds. Four other family members suffered burns.

name: 'Aead 'Abd al-Hadi 'Abd al-Khaleq Abu Nada
notes: Killed while riding a moped home from work.

name: Sami Khalil Sa'id Lazan
notes: Killed at his home in a-Sudaniya neighborhood. His wife was injured in the incident.

name: Qusai Riyad Muhammad al-Batrikhi
notes: Killed after he and other armed persons fired rockets at Israel.

name: Ayman Muhammad Muhammad 'Afanah

name: Asmaa Ibrahim Hussein 'Afanah
notes: Killed while standing on the roof of a house with members of her family.

name: Suhair Ziad Ramadan a-Nimer
notes: Killed while standing on the roof of her house with members of her family.

name: Wiam Jamal Mahmoud al-Kafarneh
notes: Killed while she was at home with members of her family, all of whom were wounded in the shelling.

name: Safeyeh Salem Hussein Haydar
notes: Killed while next to her house.

name: 'Omar Sa'dallah 'Abd al-Jawad al-Jaru
notes: Killed at home with his family.

name: Rashad Helmi Mahmoud a-Samuni
notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. The next morning, the house was bombed and collapsed on its occupants, killing 21 of the family, and injuring many. For two days, soldiers prohibited the Red Cross from removing the injured.

name: Rahmeh Muhammad Mahmoud a-Samuni

name: 'Atiyyah Helmi Mahmoud a-Samuni
notes: Shot and killed by soldiers who came into the house and opened fire. His four-year-old son later died from his wounds, after soldiers did not let an ambulance enter the area. Other family members were wounded.

name: Ahmad 'Atiyyah Helmi a-Samuni
notes: Shot by soldiers who came into the house and opened fire, killing his father, 'Attiyah a-Samuni, and wounding him and others in the family. Soldiers did not let ambulances enter the area, and he died.

name: Layla Nabih Mahmoud a-Samuni
notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. name: Iyad 'Izzat 'Ali a-Samuni
notes: Shot in the leg by soldiers while walking at the head of a group from the Samuni family who were trying to leave the area, his hands bound and waving a white flag. The soldiers refused to let the family evacuate him.

name: Razaqeh Wael Fares a-Samuni
notes: Killed in a-Zeitun neighborhood when soldiers ordered the extended Samuni family to gather in the house of one of the family members. name: Farah 'Ammar Fouad al-Hilu

name: Fouad Mahmoud Hassan al-Hilu
notes: Killed by the gunfire of soldiers who had entered his house.

name: Hisham Hamdan al-'Abed al-Fayumi

name: Muhammad Naser 'Atiyyah Hamdunah

name: Muhammad Mu'in 'Atiyyah Abu al-Jidyan
notes: Killed while on the street with friends.

name: Ahmad Hussein 'Abd Rabo al-Mabhuh
notes: Killed next to his house, near a group of armed persons operating in the area.

name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Hamid As'ad Abu Kmeil
notes: Killed when he was about to fire rockets at Israel.

name: Ahmad Khader Diab Sbieh
notes: Killed with his cousin while playing on the roof of the house.

name: Mahmoud Khaled 'Alian al-Masharawi
notes: Killed with his cousin while playing on the roof of the house.

name: 'Abed a-Sayyed Yusef Khamis 'Omar
notes: Killed in a-Salatin neighborhood where there was an exchange of fire between Palestinian operatives and soldiers.

name: Wael Yusef Matar Abu Jarad
notes: Killed when he went up to the second floor of his house in a-Zeitun neighborhood to get water for his family. His name was mentioned on the Fatah website as a combatant, but B'Tselem's investigation found no evidence to support the claim.

name: 'Arafah Hani 'Arafat 'Abd a-Dayem

name: 'Abed Hassan Muhammad Barbakh

name: Yusef 'Abed Muhsen Barbakh

name: Mahdi 'Abed Hassan Barbakh

name: Muhammad 'Abed Hassan Barbakh

name: Ibrahim Kamal Subhi 'Awajeh

name: 'Aead 'Imad Jamal Khaireh
notes: Killed while walking in an area in which armed persons were present.

name: Anas 'Aref 'Aref Barakah

name: Rida Khalil Hassan 'Ali

name: Bahaa a-Din מואאיד Kamal Abu Wadi

name: Muhammad Faraj Isma'il Hasunah

name: Lutfi 'Awni 'Abd al-Fatah Jadu'

notes: Killed with his two brothers when their house in a-Sabra neighborhood was bombed.

notes: Killed in the yard of the UNRWA Asma'a school, where his family had found refuge.

name: 'Ata Samir 'Ata Bhar

name: a-Sayed Jawwad Muhammad a-Siksik

notes: Killed in the bombing of al-Maqadmeh mosque, in which the army contended ammunition and weapons were stored. 15 persons were killed in the bombing, among them five members of the Hamas military wing and one person from the Islamic Jihad military wing.

name: 'Abd a-Satart Walid 'Abd a-Rahman al-Astal
notes: Killed with two children from his family while playing in the street.

name: Shirin Sa'id Rayan
notes: Wife of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. The army warned the family, but they refused to leave.

name: Nawal Isma'il Rayan
notes: Wife of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. According to officials, the army warned the family but they refused to leave the house.

name: Hiyam 'Abd a-Rahman Rayan
notes: Wife of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. According to officials, the army warned the family but they refused to leave the house.

name: Iman Khalil Rayan
notes: Wife of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. The army warned the family, but they refused to leave.

name: Halimah Nizar 'Abd al-Qader Rayan
notes: Daughter of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. The army warned the family, but they refused to leave.

name: As'ad Nizar 'Abd al-Qader Rayan
notes: Son of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. He was killed along with 15 members of his family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. The army warned the family, but they refused to leave.

name: Ousamah Nizar 'Abd al-Qader Rayan
notes: Son of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. He was killed along with 15 members of his family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. The army warned the family, but they refused to leave.

name: Muhammad Maher Sayah Abu Sweireh
notes: Wounded while on his way home with Muhammad 'Alian. Apparently, armed persons had fired rockets into Israel from the area they were in. Taken for treatment to Egypt and then Saudi Arabia, where he died from his wounds.

name: Nizar 'Abd al-Qader Muhammad Rayan
notes: Senior Hamas official. Killed with his four wives and 11 children. The army contends his house was used to store ammunition and that a tunnel had been built under it. Army officials state that the family had been warned about the impending attack, but they refused to leave the house.

name: 'Uyun Jihad Yusef a-Nasleh
notes: Killed with her infant brother while at home with her family in a-Nada Towers.

name: Muhammad Husam Radwan 'Alian
notes: Hit while on his way home with Muhammad Abu Swirah. Apparently, armed militants fired rockets into Israel from the area they were in.

name: Fatimah Salah Isma'il Salah
notes: Killed while she was at home with her family.

name: Fadi Naser Musa Shabat
notes: Killed while standing with other persons at the entrance to his father's shop. A number of persons, including children, were injured in the incident. About half an hour earlier, armed operatives had fired rockets from a nearby location.

name: Rim Nizar 'Abd al-Qader Rayan
notes: Daughter of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 15 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. The army warned the family, but they refused to leave.

name: al-Mu'iz Ldin Allah Jihad Yusef a-Nasleh
notes: Killed with his sister while at home with his family in a-Nada Towers.

name: Jamil 'Ali Muhammad a-Dardasawi
notes: Killed while riding in a car.

name: Mahmoud Mustafa Darwish 'Ashur
notes: A policeman, he was killed while trying to fire rockets at Israel.

name: 'Eashah Nizar 'Abd al-Qader Rayan
notes: Daughter of Nizar Rayan, a senior Hamas official. She was killed along with 16 members of her family when the family's house was bombed. The army contends that the house was used to store ammunition and a tunnel had been built under it. The army warned the family, but they refused to leave.

name: Iman Hassan Mahmoud Abu 'Aridah

name: Muhammad Isma'il 'Abed Abu Daqah
notes: Killed with Nafez Abu Sabt after helping his neighbors remove the contents of their house that had been bombed by the army. Was riding in a wagon on which the contents, including gas canisters, had been loaded. B'Tselem checked reports contending that they had been transporting weapons, but found no support for the claim.

name: 'Ali Zuheir Mahmoud al-Hubi

name: Ayman Saleh Ahmad Shabat

name: Thaer Jihad Ahmad a-Najar

name: Shehdeh Hamdan Hussein Abu Teilakh

name: Nafez Kamal 'Abd al-Jawad Abu Sabt

He went on a wagon that had items from the house, including gas canisters. B'Tselem checked reports contending they were transporting weapons, but rejected the claims.

notes: Killed when the bus she was riding on blown up.

notes: Killed when the bus she was riding on blown up.

name: Sharon Shitoubi
notes: soldier killed while standing at IDF post

notes: Killed while driving in her car.

notes: killed in a booby-trapped car near the Mahane Yehuda market.

name: Marik Gavrilov
notes: His body was found burnt in his car.
